eczema_care.title: EczemaCare
eczema_care.description: A Mobile Application for Monitoring and Tracking the Severity of Atopic Dermatitis.

learn.eczema_description: Eczema, also known as atopic dermatitis, is a chronic skin condition that causes inflamed, itchy, and red skin. It occurs when the skin's protective barrier is weakened, making it more sensitive to irritants and allergens. Eczema often starts in childhood but can affect people of all ages.
learn.eczema_curable_description: Unfortunately, there is no cure for eczema. However, it can be managed with proper remedy and care. Symptoms can come and go, with periods of flare-ups followed by times of remission. Long-term management focuses on reducing flare-ups and controlling symptoms.
learn.types_of_eczema_description: There are several types of eczema, including Atopic Dermatitis, Contact Dermatitis, Dyshidrotic Eczema, Nummular Eczema, Seborrheic Dermatitis, and Stasis Dermatitis.
learn.symptoms_description: Eczema symptoms can vary, but common signs include dry, scaly, or cracked skin, itching, red or inflamed skin, small raised bumps that may leak fluid, thickened skin, and sensitive skin that reacts to irritants.
learn.remedies_description: Eczema remedies typically involves Moisturizers, Topical Steroids, Antihistamines, Wet Wrap Therapy, Phototherapy, and Lifestyle Adjustments.
learn.what_to_do_description: Keep Skin Moisturized, Use Gentle Skincare Products, Wear Soft, Breathable Fabrics, Manage Stress, and See a Dermatologist.
learn.what_to_avoid_description: Avoid Harsh Soaps and Detergents, Hot Showers or Baths, Scratching, Environmental Triggers, and Rough or Synthetic Fabrics.
learn.disclaimer_description: This application is designed to help track and monitor the severity of a patient’s eczema. It is not intended to replace professional medical advice or remedy. If symptoms persist or worsen, please consult your doctor for further evaluation and care.

how_to_use.how_to_use_the_camera_description:
To use the camera in the EczemaCare app:
1. Navigate to the “Camera” section from the app menu.
2. Point your camera at the affected skin area you want to monitor.
3. Tap the shutter button to take a clear photo.
4. Save the image, which will be stored in your personal health records for easy reference.

Tip: Ensure good lighting and a close-up shot for better accuracy.
how_to_use.what_is_the_camera_for_description:
The camera feature in the EczemaCare app allows you to:
• Take photos of your skin condition to track changes over time.
• Compare current skin health with past images to observe improvements or flare-ups.
• Store the images in the app for the healthcare provider to view and provide better diagnosis and management.
how_to_use.when_to_answer_poem: When to Answer the POEM Survey
how_to_use.when_to_answer_poem_description:
You should complete the POEM (Patient-Oriented Eczema Measure) survey:
• Once a week to monitor your eczema symptoms. The survey can be taken as needed for when the case gets worse.
• After significant changes in your condition or remedy adjustments.
• Before a scheduled check-up with your healthcare provider to give them updated information about your symptoms.
how_to_use.how_to_use_the_tracker_description:
To use the tracker effectively:
1. Access the Tracker section from the menu.
2. Input details about your symptoms, medications, and daily skin care routine.
3. Use the tracker to log any changes in your skin condition or flare-ups.
4. Review your progress by checking the weekly or monthly summaries to see patterns or improvements.
how_to_use.what_is_the_poem_score_description:
The POEM score is a measure used to assess the severity of your eczema symptoms. It’s based on a series of questions related to:
• Itching and discomfort.
• Sleep disturbance.
• Frequency and extent of eczema flare-ups.

Your responses generate a score, which helps both you and your healthcare provider understand how well your eczema is being managed and whether remedy adjustments are needed.
how_to_use.how_can_i_get_treatment_description:
For remedy options:
1. Visit the Remedy section in the app, where you’ll find personalized recommendations based on your POEM score and tracking data.
2. Schedule an appointment with your dermatologist through the app's integrated telehealth feature, or consult your healthcare provider in person.
3. Ensure you follow the prescribed remedy plan, including medications, moisturizers, and lifestyle adjustments.

Note: Always consult a healthcare professional before making any changes to your remedy plan.

poem_survey.title: POEM
poem_survey.description: Complete the POEM questionnaire once a week to monitor changes in your skin condition. Please answer the following questions carefully, rating each on a scale from 0 (lowest) to 7 (highest). Your responses will be totaled at the end to indicate the severity of your eczema.
questions: Over the last week, on how many days has your/your child’s skin been itchy because of the eczema?
Over the last week, on how many nights has your/your child's sleep been disturbed because of the eczema?
Over the last week, on how many days has your/your child’s skin been bleeding because of the eczema?
Over the last week, on how many days has your/your child’s skin been weeping or oozing clear fluid because of the eczema?
Over the last week, on how many days has your/your child’s skin been cracked because of the eczema?
Over the last week, on how many days has your/your child’s skin been flaking off because of the eczema?
Over the last week, on how many days has your/your child’s skin felt dry or rough because of the eczema?

camera.title: CAMERA
camera.description: Use the camera to capture images for skin condition recognition. Follow the instructions below for better accuracy.

step1.title: Step 1: Lighting
step1.description: Ensure the area is well-lit. Natural lighting is preferred for better accuracy in recognizing skin conditions.

step2.title: Step 2: Positioning
step2.description: Hold the camera steady and ensure the affected skin is centered in the frame. Keep the phone 6-8 inches away.

step3.title: Step 3: Focus
step3.description: Make sure the image is clear and not blurry. Tap on the screen to focus on the area of interest.

privacy_policy.heading: Privacy Policy
privacy_policy.intro_paragraph: EczemaCare is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy outlines how we collect, use, share, and protect your personal information. By using EczemaCare, you agree to the collection and use of information as described in this policy.

medical_information.title: Medical Information
items: Images of affected skin areas (uploaded by the user)
Responses and scores from the POEM (Patient-Oriented Eczema Measure) survey

how_we_use_information.title: 2. How We Use Your Information
how_we_use_information.paragraph: EczemaCare uses your information for the following purposes:
purposes: REMEDY TRACKING: Your POEM survey scores allow us to monitor changes in your condition over time.
COMMUNICATION: We may use your contact details to notify you about important updates, responses, or recommendations regarding your eczema care.
RESEARCH AND ANALYSIS: Aggregated, anonymized data may be used for internal research to improve our services. Individual information will not be shared without your explicit consent.

data_sharing_and_disclosure.title: 3. Data Sharing and Disclosure
data_sharing_and_disclosure.paragraph: We will not share your personal information with third parties except:
conditions: WITH YOUR CONSENT: We may share information with third parties when you explicitly consent.
FOR LEGAL REQUIREMENTS: We may disclose information if required by law, court order, or government regulation.

WITH OUR MEDICAL VALIDATOR: EczemaCare collaborates with a medical expert to ensure the effectiveness and accuracy of remedy recommendations. Your anonymized data may be shared with the medical expert for validation purposes.

data_security.title: 4. Data Security
data_security.paragraph: We implement robust security measures to protect your personal information from unauthorized access, use, or disclosure. However, no method of data transmission over the internet is 100% secure, and we cannot guarantee absolute security.

data_retention.title: 5. Data Retention
data_retention.paragraph: We will retain your information as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this Privacy Policy or as required by law. You may request deletion of your personal data by contacting us directly, and we will process your request per applicable laws.

your_rights.title: 6. Your Rights
your_rights.paragraph: You have the right to access, correct, or request deletion of your personal information. If you would like to exercise any of these rights, please contact us through our support email at [Support Email].
